text: High overhead shot looking down on the Pacific Ocean.

WIDE ON a plume of black smoke rising high into the air. CLOSER ON a 1965 Ford Galaxy engulfed in flames. DOROTHEA (55, short grey hair, Amelia Earhart androgyny) (15, New-Wave/Punk) jog their shopping cart toward the co stunned to find their car in flames. Dorothea looks at th then at her son Jamie, concerned. People run for help. Si the background.
That was my husband’s Ford Galaxy. We drove Jamie home from the hospital in that car.
My mom was 40 when she had me. Everyone told her she was too old to be a mother.
I put my hand through the little window, and he’d squeeze my finger, and I'd tell him life was very big, and unknown;
And she told me that there were animals and sky and cities,
Music, movies. He’d fall in love, have his own children, have passions, have meaning, have his mom and dad.

HAND THROUGH 3. BABY’S

8. BACK TO DOROTHEA’S HAND
BABY’S FINGERS HOLDING HAND.

When they got divorced, my father moved back east and left the car with us. He calls on birthdays and Christmas. Last time I felt close to him was on my birthday in 1974, he bought me mirrored sunglasses. I saw the president fall down the stairs, and I threw up on the 2.

You're getting on that plane.

I'm staying here with him till the plane get’s safely away.

text: JAMIE WATCHES, STILL STUNNED, LIFE’S SURPRISES.
Listen, Captain. I am having a party tonight, it’s my birthday actually, and I would like you to drop by so I can feed you
It’s not necessary Mrs. Fields.
It’s Dorothea - no, I insist, please? That way I can thank you. She hands her address to them.
Jamie and Dorothea sit on a side bumper of a fire truck, movement around them. They look small, sit close, groceri at their feet. Dorothea watches Jamie. The fire scared her. She looks vulnerable.
That was a beautiful car.
Mom, it smelled like gas and overheated all the time, and it was just old... Dorothea’s surprised, she didn’t know they felt so differently about the car.
(What?) Well it wasn’t always old. Dorothea goes to touch his hair. He bends away from her h Jamie turns to his mom, trying to explain the contemporar world to her.
You know, when the firemen come, people don’t usually invite them over for dinner. Camera tracks away, revealing them like refugees in the parking lot.
Yeah? Why not?

INT. MARY’S THERAPY PLACE - DAY Camera pans across teen therapy girl (IMPROVISE THERAPY TALK), sees a circle of 6 other teen girls having therapy lands on JULIE (17, Something subversive below her good looks) similarly bored. The therapist MARY, (40’s academi listens. Julie stares at Mary, criticality brewing inside her. EXT. OUTSIDE MARY’S OFFICE Julie lights up a cigarette, her real self, gets on her b
Julie smokes and rides her bike, her real self more on vi

ABBIE (28, Sophisticated NYC art-punk type) stands in gow OBGYN office, looking confused, vulnerable, but armed wit late 70's clunky Nikon camera. She studies her doctor put a swab into a tube, writing her name; she takes a photogr Turns and takes a photo of the room, her doctor is used t this. She watches an assistant come in and take the swab (and h future fate) in its plastic container away - go down the hall, and disappear around a corner.

The technician carries the little swab down the hall, ina clear plastic bag. INT. DOROTHEA’S SIDE DOOR Abbie walks in, looking lost, puts her bag down in the kitchen. INT. ABBIE’S ROOM Now in her room, Talking Heads playing loudly, her pain p and she begins to dance alone. EXT. DOROTHEA’S HOUSE Julie rides her bike past a line of old VWs and an old 30 Chevy. INT. DOROTHEA’S HOUSE Julie enters the house, walks towards WILLIAM (Mid 40's p hippie type).  5. William takes on a major job on his own (tearing down cei in entry way). Reveal that this is a big house, needing repair under serious renovations.

Oh, hey, sorry. Jamie’s not here right now. Julie walks past this. Follows the sound of music upstair INT. HALLWAY/ABBIE’S ROOM Julie can see Abbie dancing through a partially opened do Abbie captivates her, she walks towards the room, Abbie s her, snaps out of her dancing, turns off the record. Julie enters, Abbie’s still troubled by her OBGYN visit, Julie can’t really take her eyes off Abbie.
They’re not home. Abbie takes her picture.
Don't. That doesn’t stop Abbie. Not mean, just stubborn.
I'm taking pictures of everything that happens to me in a day.
I don’t like having my picture taken. I didn’t happen to you. She takes another. INT. DOROTHEA’S KITCHEN AREA Dorothea and Jamie make their way to the kitchen with all groceries.
Hello.
Hey. William enters and helps them, Julie and Abbie enter a be later.
Hi. She hands William a bag of groceries.
You aren’t going to believe what happened.
Our car burst into flames in the parking lot.
Seriously?
You OK?
How did it happen?
I don’t know, they said probably just something electrical. We walked out and it was just sitting there, on fire. Life’s surprises.
Oh man, I’m sorry. Everyone’s perplexed. William helps unload groceries. Julie and Jamie IMPROV in background.  7. DOROTHEA PULLS ABBIE ASIDE, LOOKS AT HER, ABBIE DOESN’T W TO SHARE.
So, what happened?
They never tell you anything, I won't know for like a week. Dorothea gives her an encouraging look. ABBIE (CONT’D) I’m gonna be late on rent.
That’s okay, Don’t worry about that.
Thanks. Abbie looks at Dorothea with love and admiration. INT. JAMIE’S BEDROOM - DAY Jamie lies flat on his bed. Julie’s next to him, processi earnestly worried for him.
What if you had been in the car? He shrugs, gestures with his hand. She lays beside him on side. She traces a finger across his hair, his forehead, nose, chest, their hands touch.
I wouldn’t be here. You would’ve missed me?
(Yeah) Don’t joke. She traces a finger across his hair, his forehead, nose, chest, their hands touch. He puts his hand on her bare kn starts to slide up her leg. She easily pulls his hand off
It was so much easier before you got all horny. He’s tried this before, but he is really just her friend. He leans away from her.
It’s not like you, don’t -
Do it? She likes that she does it. He smiles, used to her love o being provocative. Then serious.
Friends can’t have sex and still be friends. She snuggles him again innocently, pressing her face into arm.
I like us like we are - OK?
off screen, from far away. DOROTHEA O.S. Jamie ... Can you come help set up please?
Can my mom just chill out?
She's compensating for her loneliness. INT. DOROTHEA’S ENTRY WAY William takes Dorothea to see the ceiling he worked on. S loves it. It’s pretty messed up. IMPROVISE ABOUT THE WORK DONE.
Dorothea, all that is beautiful molding there.
It is.
I want to continue that around the side.
All right so we’re gonna have to re- match that, is that actually wood, or is that plaster?

No, the plaster is underneath it, the molding on the outside there is wood. It'll take some time... INT. DOROTHEA’S DINING ROOM - NIGHT Her party’s in full swing. An eclectic mix of people. 15 the regulars; construction guys, straight looking draftin men, a few women Dorothea’s age, and 4 firemen from befor People are all talking and drinking, eating and moving ar the room. WE CROSS BETWEEN MANY SHORT INTERWOVEN MOMENTS WITHIN THE PARTY. CAMERA MOVES WITH Dorothea showing the CHIEF a little of the house. William silently glides with them.

It was built in 1905, the same family had it forever, but they lost all their money during the war, there was a fire - you should’ve been here for that. Anyway, so it was just a mess, they just let it fall apart. Then a bohemian inherited it in the 60’s, bunch of free spirits lived here, and they lost it to the bank.
It’s beautiful.  10.
(I think so) I completely fell in love with it. CAMERA FINDS WILLIAM AND ABBIE, sitting on the couch talk

We’re connected to the dirt because we came from the dirt. The dirt is made of stars and star dust the same way we are, so when you put your hands into that dirt and feel the earth mother... She laughs. INT. DOROTHEA'’S KITCHEN Dorothea busily makes her famous angel food and strawberr messy pile of a cake. Jamie’s putting in the candles. William’s piling up the plates to take in.
William, it looks as though I’m gonna be in need of a car. Do you think you have something cheap? Maybe that ‘49 deluxe?
I think we can work something out, maybe we’ll trade for rent or something.
Sure. He takes the plates into the dining room. Dorothea finishes lighting the candles, to Jamie.

OK, give me a minute, then come in. She trots off to the party - Jamie waits a minute then he in. INT. DOROTHEA’S DINING ROOM - DAY Jamie brings the cake into the dining room, applause, che she’s happy - blows out the candles.
My mom was born in 1924. When she was my age people drove in sad cars to sad houses with old phones, no money or food or televisions but the people were real.
When she was 16, the war broke out and she had to leave school.
Her dream was to be a pilot in the air force. She actually went to flight school. But the war ended before she was done.

She became the first woman to work in the Continental Can Company drafting room. Then she met my dad. Then I came. Then they got divorced. But people from her time never admit anything went wrong. 11.
10. REPORTAGE OF 40’S ERA DRAFTING ROOMS.
INT. DOROTHEA’S DRAFTING ROOM — DAY Dorothea works and smokes.
Dorothea and EIGHT YEAR OLD JAMIE are sitting at a bank d talking with a MANAGER.
What do you mean?  12.
He’s too young to have an account in his name only - little guy.
He’s a person, not a half person, not some cute little guy, he has volition and autonomy and privacy and he needs a bank account. Can you do that for us?
I’m sorry, he’s too young. INT. JAMIE’S SCHOOL - DAY Dorothea and 13 YEAR-OLD JAMIE are sitting in a school of being scolded by a principal type. He hands her a note, s resents this authority figure.
Jamie, you can’t just keep skipping school and making excuses.
Well wait a minute, why not? Why can’t he skip school? If he has a legitimate need to be away?
Then I need a legitimate real note from you with your real signature. Hands her Jamie’s forged note.

Okay, wow, how did you forge my signature so well? INT. DOROTHEA’S 1977 HOUSE - DAY CUT TO: 12 year-old hands holding a check with Dorothea’s signature against a window, then placing the note over it tracing the signature.
That's really ingenious. But, never forge someone's signature, or do something behind their back.  13.
12 year old Jamie walks in and hands a note to the secret CLOSE ON the note.

Please excuse Jamie from school this morning, he was doing volunteer work for the Sandinistas. The secretary looks incredulous, but files the note and l Jamie head to class. DIFFERENT DAY: Jamie walks in, hands over a note. CLOSE O note.
Please excuse Jamie from school this morning, he was involved in a small plane accident, fortunately he was not hurt. The secretary looks up at Jamie and files the note.
William tries to teach Jamie how to help out around the h with Dorothea’s encouragement. IMPROVISE TALKING ABOUT RENOVATIONS.
You're going to be in for a legendary surprise. It’s mahogany underneath. JAMIE V.O. She's always trying to bring a man into my life.
This is probably Honduran mahogany, really fine grain... CUT TO Dorothea and Jamie whispering away from William.
This is like, really boring, Hey watch it, he’s helping m he’s talking about wood and out, restore the house O.K.? stuff.  14. INT. DOROTHEA’S 1975 KITCHEN - MORNING - 1975
She writes down her stocks every morning, 10 YEAR OLD Jamie’s and Dorothea’s backs as they’re hunch over the stock reports, writing down the day’s numbers.

She smokes Salems because 11. SALEMS 12. HER they're healthier, wears BIRKENSTOCKS 13. DOROTHEA Birkenstocks because she’s WORKS IN HOME OFFICE 14. contemporary. She read DOROTHEA READING ALONE IN BED Watership Down and learned SMOKING. how to carve rabbits out of wood. And she never dates a man for very long. INT. DOROTHEA’S FRONT DOOR / BACK TO DOROTHEA’S BIRTHDAY The partygoers are heading out, Dorothea saying her good- foreground Julie whispers with Jamie.
See you later?
Just don’t hang out with that Chris guy anymore, okay? He’s a skeez and he’s kind of dumb.
Exactly.  15. Turns to Dorothea as she leaves,
Happy birthday.
Bye Julie. She leaves Jamie and Dorothea alone on the doorstep.
Stop.
What?
Thinking you know everything that’s going on.
Having your heart broken is a tremendous way to learn about the world. INT. DOROTHEA'’S KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS They’re alone now, doing the dishes together, he studies
Do you think you’re happy, like as happy as you thought you’d be when you were my age?
Seriously, you don’t just ask people questions like that.
You're my mom.
Especially your mom. Look, wondering if you’re happy is a great shortcut to being depressed.  16. He looks at her disappointed.

Dorothea is alone. Lost in thought. An ironing board in t background. Just smoking and thinking. Then, from above, plays. She looks up, in the direction of the sound. Rises INT. ABBIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Jamie and Abbie sit together, listening to The Raincoats Fairytale In The Supermarket. Abbie’s looking at the cove Jamie's looking through her other records. Dorothea appears in the doorway, observing her son, and h obvious love of this. She enters, sits down and listens w them, an awkward moment.
What is that?
It’s The Raincoats. She nods awkwardly to the beat, trying to relate.
Can’t things just be pretty?
“Pretty” music’s used to hide how unfair and corrupt society is.
Ah, okay so... they’re not very good, and they know that, right? He just looks at her - ‘why’re you still here’ - she look him confused by his pushing her away. Seriously curious.

Yea, it’s like they’ve got this feeling, and they don’t have any skill, and they don’t want skill, because it’s really interesting what happens when your passion is bigger than the tools you have to deal with it. It creates this energy that’s raw. Isn’t it great?  17. CU on Dorothea feeling like an outsider, lost. INT. DOROTHEA’S BEDROOM Dorothea sits at the edge of her bed, smoking and thinkin
My son was born in 1964.

He grew up with a meaningless 1. VIET NAM BURNING ON war, with protests, with TELEVISION 2. 1968 PROTEST ON Nixon, with nice cars and TELEVISION 3. NIXON ON nice houses, computers, TELEVISION 4. CAR SALESMAN ON drugs, boredom. TV 5. FAST FOOD COMMERCIAL ON
Jamie dances wildly alone, to punk music. DOROTHEA V.O. I know him less every day.

Jamie skateboards down San Leandro, free, like he’s flyin DOROTHEA V.O. He said it was just a game. EXT. MONTECITO RAMP AREA -— DAY Jamie watches other kids do “the fainting game”. One kid hyperventilates, another pulls on his diaphragm from behi The kid faints and gets up, everyone laughs. DOROTHEA V.O. You breathe real hard and another kid pulls on your diaphragm and you faint. Now Jamie tries it. He breathes heavily, kid pulls on his diaphragm from behind, FILM BEGINS TO SPEED UP, Jamie fai he falls, he doesn’t wake up.  18. DOROTHEA V.O. He said you’re supposed to come to a few seconds later, but it took Jamie almost a half an hour to wake up. Julie runs from the ramp where she’s been watching all th She tries to wake him, tell’s others to get help, she’s panicked.
Julie runs for help.
INT. ABBIE’S CAR - DAY Jamie is still unconscious, his head in Dorothea’s lap. S looks terrified. Abbie and Julie are there, William drive
William runs, carries Jamie’s limp body into the hospital everyone follows.
LOOKING DOWN ON Jamie. STILL IN FAST MOTION. They all watch nurses and doctors take his vitals. It’s a confusing blur.
(Tech talk - he’s stable - We just have to wait - EKG) Nurses (Nurse tech talk, he’s stable) They turn to rush Jamie to a bed. A doctor takes Dorothea the arm.

Can you tell me what happened? A parent's wild guilt and fear on her face. NEARBY: Jamie’s on a gurney, put into a small screened-in area, still limp, unconscious, swarmed by nurses and tech  19. Abbie and Julie get swept-up in the screened off area. Th two would never be together if it weren’t for Dorothea an Jamie; Abbie, an older punk, Julie, a younger AP student. The girls watch nurses take off his shirt, put on EKG nod his body is limp, Abbie starts to silently cry, Julie too Dorothea finds Jamie’s screened in area. William sits politely outside. His concern is for Dorothea. NOW Behind the screen, DOROTHEA FREEZES when she sees the wires all over his bare chest. Abbie and Julie are squish into a corner. Dorothea moves around the nurses and technicians still working, she finds his hand, puts it in both of hers, presses her forehead against it. She takes his hand, like she did when he was a baby in th isolette, closes her eyes. JAMIE REGAINS CONSCIOUSNESS - disorientated and confused, clumsily tries to pull off the oxygen canula.
He’s back. The nurses and doctor scramble around him, doing vitals, asking questions.
What’s your name? Confused, but present.

Jamie... Jamie Fields. Dorothea looks on relieved but destroyed by this. FAST MOTION ENDS. INT. JAMIE’S HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT Jamie's asleep in hospital bed, Dorothea sits next to him worried, touching his hair. She gets up.
She exits his room, exhausted, she finds Julie and Abbie waiting in the hallway. This means a lot to Dorothea, she sit’s next to them.  20.
Jamie walks ahead going up the stairs. She walks behind, eying him. Her worry and fear rising, until she says...
Why did you do something so - stupid (dangerous).
I don’t know mom, everyone was doing it. Escalating fear and anger with each line.
So you just went along with it?
It looked like fun.
That’s just dumb. Why would you do something so stupid? Just following along? You know you almost died, right? He gets very defensive, feels attacked.
You don’t need to worry about me. She doesn’t buy it.
Why don’t you think? He turns away from her.

Jamie, hey. What’s going on with you? He walks off to his room. She follows. INT. JAMIE’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS She storms into his room, when she enters he heads to the other side. Dorothea’s quite angry now.  21.
(Jamie?!) What? You won’t talk to me now? He confronts her like he never has before.
I’m not the one who doesn’t talk. Dorothea’s surprised.
What? Come on, you scared the hell out of me. Why did you hurt yourself like that?
Why do you smoke yourself to death? (Some specificity) Why don’t you go on dates?
(Shocked) Hey- Jamie is terrified, but he can’t stop.
Why’re you fine being sad and alone?

We don’t talk to each other like that. (What’s happening to you.) He storms off, she’s struck, she sits alone, she cries. INT. DOROTHEA’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Dorothea, still struggling, enters the living room, a mov blankly on the TV, she’s surprised to find Jamie asleep o couch. She sits and looks at him, something she doesn’t get to d anymore - thinking as she looks at him.  22.
WIDE ON a beautiful beach in afternoon sun. In street clothes, they look out of place surrounded by bikini-shor clad happy beachgoers. Dorothea looks at the girls, nervo She starts walking.
I think history’s been tough on men, they can’t be what they were, and they cant figure out what’s next.
What’re we talking about? Dorothea struggles, wants them just to understand.
Men?
I think history and men? They stand talking on the beach... CONVERSATION PRELAPS...
I think maybe you guys...
CLOSE on Dorothea - conversation continues. She is vulnerable. Seated at the table with Abbie and Julie.
.--.could help me - with Jamie. Julie and Abbie look to each other and Dorothea. What’s s asking?
He needs help figuring out how to be himself in all this mess. And I can’t be there, I can’t be there with him, I need to let go.  23.
Is this because of the fainting thing? He’s fine.
(No) it’s because of everything.
I don’t understand what you’re asking.
How do you be a good man? I don’t know how you do that nowadays. He’s only got me, I mean, it’s not enough.
You're serious?
What about William? He’s a guy, wouldn’t he be better for this? The girls look at each other, they take this more serious
Have you ever seen them have a conversation? Very vulnerable for Dorothea, like a failure.
He doesn’t connect to men. He likes you two... he likes you two a lot.
But what if I’m not good at it?  24.
He’s my friend, I don’t want to be his mom.
No, I’m his mom.
Don’t you need a man to raise a man?
I don’t think so. I think you’re what’s gonna work for him. The girls don’t know what to think.

He just has me, think about it, that’s not enough. I/E. MONTECITO STREETS - DOROTHEA’S CAR - DAY From inside Dorothea’s car we watch Jamie skateboarding d steep street. Dorothea loves this, we see her smile at hi flight. MOMENTS LATER: The car is parked at the bottom of the hil just delivered the news. Jamie’s angry, mortified, confus more vulnerable and scared than she knows.
Help me with what?
Go through this part of your life, it’s not easy, it’s not easy for anybody.
You asked them to help me? He gets out of the car, slams the door, but doesn’t know to go. She’s heartbroken but sticking with her plan.  25.
I think they get it, Jamie. They like you.
They said yes? Well, not exactly.
Yeah.
Fuck. Hey?!
You just feel guilty - cause it’s just you and me.
You don’t know what I’m feeling.
Right, exactly, tell me. That’s complicated for her.
Jamie...
You never tell me what’s going on with you, you just do things. He skates off - his face filled with anger. She's not used to him being this mad at her. She watches further and further away.

Jamie skates with other kids. 7-10 kids hang out, some sk some watching, smoking, talking. Jamie’s still angry. He overhears some older, tougher loo kids talking about going to a punk show in LA. Jamie approaches them, they look at him.  26.
You guys going to LA?
Jamie's in the far back. The older punk kids are driving, excitedly about their adventure. Jamie mostly watches, bu this adventure.

A seedy section of Sunset, Jamie finishes a call and hang payphone. INT. DOROTHEA’S DINING ROOM - NIGHT Dorothea, Abbie, and William are eating. Jamie’s conspicu absent, a place set for him. William returns to the table phone.
That was Jamie. He’s in LA, him and some friends went to a show.
She lights up, she doesn’t look worried.
Aren’t you worried?
He’s mad at me. This is his way of dealing with it, it’s his right to be
If it made him this mad, maybe it wasn’t a good idea? Dorothea looks at Abbie, smokes, inscrutable.
We see and intense swirling mosh pit, amidst all this act we see Jamie's body whirling by, his face ecstatic.

THE GERMS, BLACK FLAG, THE WEIRDOS, THE MASQUE CLUB.

text: INT. DOROTHEA'’S HOUSE - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Hard cut to Dorothea working on the house late at night. sees Dorothea down the hall, working away, hard on hersel looks up and sees him. Why is it easy for her to be vulne William?
Maybe I did do the wrong thing?
Jamie's energy’s very unstable, I think that’s why he does all this.
Well there’s an energy crisis, that must be playing into it. He just looks at her sincerely, why joke?

You don’t have a lot of funny lines do you? He doesn’t react. She leaves the room, seemingly fine. INT. DOROTHEA’S BEDROOM She sits in bed and smokes, and thinks, and worries. EXT. DOROTHEA’S HOUSE - NIGHT Camera finds Julie, sneaking up to Dorothea’s house in th dark.
Julie sneaks into his window. The way she does it tells u she’s done it a lot. She whispers for him but he’s not there. Has this ever happened? She sits on his bed, lonely.

Jamie. She decides to get undressed, get’s into bed.  28. INT. ABBIE’S ROOM Abbie’s taking photographs in her room, listening to Siou And The Banshees. She takes a photo of her red shoes on a grey backdrop, she’s excited.
William’s still recovering from Dorothea’s rejection. Abb in, filled with energy.
Hey.
Hey.
I had a new idea, for my work. Maybe just shoot all my stuff, everything I own, or everything that’s important to me. A portrait of myself through all the objects I own? Can I show you?
Yeah? She lays out polaroids for him to see.

Bra, birth control, “On Photography” by Susan Sontag, my shoes, underwear, a picture of a picture of my mom... I’m gonna do a bunch of them. He looks through some of her test Polaroids. Sort of immediately engrossed.

It’s sad in a way isn’t it? All this stuff? You know what I mean? She didn’t expect him to get it. She’s looking at one of objects as she talks. Longer eye contact than usual.  29. He sits, looks at her, his hand is next to her hand. Some going on for her, takes a beat to say it.
You want to fool around, with me?
Really? Yeah. He touches her hair. She closes her eyes, melts more than thought she would, just to be wanted is nice. She never t people about her cancer.
You know I’m recovering from cervical cancer?

I know. She can’t believe he still wants to fool around. Everyone else treats her like a leper. Takes her a beat to assess what she feels capable of. He kisses her. She smells his hair. ABBIE (CONT’D) Your hair smells good.
I make my own shampoo.
Of course you do. How did she get so far off course? She closes her eyes an him again.

Jamie and his friends drive back from LA. He takes a beer from one of his passed out friends, drinks from it. INT. DOROTHEA’S HOUSE - NIGHT Jamie enters the front door, buzzed. He makes his way dow hallway, tipsy. Puts his beer on a chair. His ears ringin  30. INT. DOROTHEA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Dorothea’s smoking in bed, pretending to read, petting Je
It's OK Jeeves, he’s home now, you can relax. INT. JAMIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Jamie sits on the edge of his bed, looking at Julie. How how great. A bit tipsy.
Where were you? He thinks this is wild.
I went to LA. We went to the Starwood, saw a show. She looks upset, he studies her.
Are you drunk? He sits down next to her, tries to kiss her.
Don't.
What’s wrong?
Tim Drammer came inside of me.
I don’t want to hear this shit.
Abandoned empty Olympic size swimming pool, Julie and fri are drinking, fucking around, some one skateboards throug all.  31.
We broke into that old pool at the rec center. Got loaded. Fucked around.
Me and Tim ended up in his mom’s Maverick.
Camera pushes in on a lone Maverick, we hear the sounds o sex, we hear Tim orgasm.
Did you just cum? INT. TIM'S MOM’S MAVERICK - NIGHT Tim’s getting up off of Julie in the back seat, she sits
You said you were gonna pull out?
Yeah, sorry. Julie plays it like it’s not a big deal, but it is a big deal.
I thought we had a deal there? CUT BACK TO JAMIE’S BEDROOM He hates hearing this.
Fuck. What’re you gonna do?  32.
It'll be fine. She's actually very worried. Her mind spins, disturbed. S the subject.
Your mom asked me to like, help, like, raise you.
Yea I know. She was raised in the Depression, everyone helped everyone. The whole neighborhood raised the kids - Sorry. She let’s him know it’s O.K. But she’s still disturbed.
Can we do therapy? Jesus, I don’t want to do therapy right now....
Let’s role play. Please no.
I’ll be your mom, you can tell her what you want to tell her.
I don’t want to talk to my mom.
What would you say to her? It takes him a beat to work up to it.

Abbie.

Of all the misconceptions about love, the most powerful and persuasive is the belief that falling in love is love, or at least one of the manifestations of love.

Love is supposed to be a feeling that you feel. People say that they’re falling in love, but they’re not actually falling in love. It’s a fake connection that you feel with someone, and marriage should never happen. INT. Good.
Next time you take a trip just tell me, I won’t make too much dinner. Jamie's pissed to have his delinquency dismissed so. Wasn she afraid?  40. CUT TO: Everyone cleaning up and heading off.

Men feel like you have to fix everything for women, or you’re not doing anything. But some things can’t be fixed. Just be there. Somehow, that’s hard for you all.

Yeah?

It may not be strong enough to go full term during pregnancy. As the baby grows, the cervix widens. If it’s weakened, it’s likely to open prematurely.
